results.title: Radioisotope analytical techniques in mineral processing
results.creator_credit: Australian Atomic Energy Commission and Perier Films
results.brief_description: Shows use of radioisotopes in continuous on-stream analysis in mineral processing. Describes how the technique was developed by the Commission and its value in immediate and accurate detection of valuable elements. Suggests possible application in automatic control.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Atomic Energy Commission and Perier Films

results.title: Radio sky
results.creator_credit: Michael Crossfield, Michael Clarke and Viewpoint Productions
results.brief_description: Radio astronomy reveals a picture of the universe beyond optical limits. How radio telescopes work is illustrated by views of various types in operation, and plotting and interpretation of radio sources is discussed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Crossfield, Michael Clarke and Viewpoint Productions

results.title: Radio service
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk, Cecil Musk Productions and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: You may expect this film, because of its title, to show you what happens when you send your radio set to a mechanic for repairs. In fact, the film deals with the enormous development of electronics during the past 50 years (prior to 1948) of modern history. Commentator: Deryck Guyler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cecil Musk, Cecil Musk Productions and Film Producers Guild

results.title: Radio astronomy in Australia
results.brief_description: The study of radio waves which celestial bodies emit and what these waves tell of the size, composition, temperature and other characteristics of these bodies. Deals with Australia’s contribution in the field and indicates the equipment involved, including the construction of a giant radio telescope.
results.description: The study of radio waves which celestial bodies emit and what these waves tell of the size, composition, temperature and other characteristics of these bodies. results.title: Radiant energy and the electromagnetic spectrum
results.brief_description: Re-enacted experiments of discovery and modern sensing devices introduce us to the various forms of radiant energy, giving insights into concepts of waves, wave-lengths and energy.

results.title: Radha and Krishna (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Among India’s legends one of the most poetic is the story of Radha and Krishna. Artists through the centuries have used this legend and the film brings to life the allegory in a series of miniature paintings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Racoons picnic
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The adventures of two young raccoons during a daylight safari in search of food. Beatrice and Willie set off through the woods and on reaching a lake, discover lunches left by two boys swimming. The boys discover the scavengers, the scavengers discover the angry boys and scamper off back to the safety of the woods.

results.title: Rabbits
results.creator_credit: John Ralmen, Lou Lilly, Films/West and Focus Films
results.brief_description: This film examines without commentary the habits and behaviour of domestic rabbits. It includes scenes of new-born and young rabbits, feeding and play activities. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Rabbit on the Moon
results.brief_description: The story of a young Italian girl growing up in the Australian suburbs of the 70s, confused by the conflicting values of her classmates and those of her Italian family. She wonders about her relatives in Italy, acts as her parents interpreter and battles with being called a wog at school. Feeling like an outsider, she seeks solace in her pet rabbit, until the rabbit meets an untimely end. Winner of several awards including the AFI”S best short fiction.
